intro: Vilfa pubescens, commonly known as the hairy vilfa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The leaves are lance-shaped, with a hairy texture, and the plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink to purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
